sen.j: 一領具足（いちりょうぐそく）は、戦国時代 (日本)の土佐国の戦国大名、長宗我部氏が兵農分離前の武装農民や地侍を対象に編成、運用した半農半兵の兵士および組織 (社会科学)の呼称である。
sen.e: Ichiryo gusoku (literally meant a set of armor) was a designation for a part time soldier and farmer and their organization (in sociology) which was formed and managed by Chosokabe clan, the daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) of Tosa Province in the Sengoku period targeting on armed peasants and jizamurai (local samurai) before heinobunri (a policy to strictly separate soldiers and farmers)).

sen.j: 土佐物語では死生知らずの野武士なりと書かれている。

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 一領具足は、平時には田畑を耕し、農民として生活をしているが、領主からの動員がかかると、一領（ひとそろい）の具足（武器、鎧）を携えて、直ちに召集に応じることを期待されていた。
sen.e: In peacetime Ichiryo gusoku lived as farmers engaged in woring the land.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In peacetime, Ichiryo gusoku lived as farmers engaged in working the land, however, once they were mobilized by the feudal lord, they were supposed to respond it at once with ichiryo (one set) of gusoku (weapon, armor).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしなくてもよいと思われますので下の文をここにまとめました。woring → working 冒頭のコンマを追加一領（ひとそろい）の具足（武器、鎧）の訳、文意が出るように修正。
sen.e: In peacetime, Ichiryo gusoku lived as farmers engaged in working the land, however, once they were mobilized by the feudal lord, they were supposed to respond it at once with ichiryo (one set) of gusoku (weapon, armor).

sen.j: 突然の召集に素早く応じられるように、農作業をしている時も、常に槍と鎧を田畑の傍らに置いていたため、一領具足と呼称された。
sen.e: To respond a sudden call-up without delay they always carried their spear and armor during their farm working, thus they called Ichiryo gusoku.
To respond a sudden call-up without delay, they always carried their spear and armor during their farm working, thus they called Ichiryo gusoku.
To respond a sudden call-up without delay, they always carried their spear and armor during their farm working, thus they called Ichiryo gusoku.

sen.j: また正規の武士であれば予備を含めて二領の具足を持っているが、半農半兵の彼らは予備が無く一領しか具足を持っていないので、こう呼ばれていたとも言う。
sen.e: Another reason for this designation was that they could not afford to have extra sets of armor and had only a set of armor, while regular samurai had two sets of armor including a spare set.
Another reason for this designation was that they could not afford to have extra sets of armor and had only a set of armor, while regular samurai had two sets of armor including a spare set.

sen.j: このような半農半兵の兵士であるから、一領具足は通常の武士が行うべき仕事は免除されていた。
sen.e: Since they were such part-time soldiers, Ichiryo gusoku were exempted tasks obligated to ordinary samurai.
Since they were such part-time soldiers, Ichiryo gusoku were exempted tasks obligated to ordinary samurai.
Since they were such part-time soldiers, Ichiryo gusoku were exempted tasks obligated to ordinary samurai.

sen.j: 農作業に従事しているために、身体壮健なものが多く、また集団行動の適性も高かったため、兵士として高い水準にあったと考えられる。
sen.e: As they were engaged in farm working, many of them were robust and had aptitude for group work, accordingly they were considered to have been high-leveled soldiers.
As they were engaged in farm working, many of them were robust and had aptitude for group work, accordingly they were considered to have been high-leveled soldiers.
As they were engaged in farm working, many of them were robust and had aptitude for group work, accordingly they were considered to have been high-leveled soldiers.

sen.j: ただし、その半農半兵という性質上、農繁期の動員は困難であり、長期にわたる戦役には耐えられなかったと推測される。
sen.e: However, depending on the nature that they were concurrently farmers, they were supposed to be hard to be mobilized during the busiest farming season and thus impossible to fight a battle over a long period of time.

However, in the nature that they were concurrently farmers, it is considered to be hard to mobilize them during the busiest farming season and thus it was impossible to make them fight battles over a long period of time.
sen.cmt: depending on → in they were supposed to be hard → it is considered to be hard など表現修正
sen.e: However, in the nature that they were concurrently farmers, it is considered to be hard to mobilize them during the busiest farming season and thus it was impossible to make them fight battles over a long period of time.

sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 一領具足を考案したのは長宗我部国親である（家臣の吉田孝頼という説もある）。
sen.e: Ichiryo gusoku was invented by Kunichika CHOSOKABE, or by one account, his vassal, Takayori YOSHIDA.
Ichiryo gusoku was invented by Kunichika CHOSOKABE (Other theory says it was invented by his vassal, Takayori YOSHIDA.).
sen.cmt: 原文にそった形に修正
sen.e: Ichiryo gusoku was invented by Kunichika CHOSOKABE (Other theory says it was invented by his vassal, Takayori YOSHIDA.).

sen.j: もっとも積極的かつ効率的に一領具足を運用したのは、国親の子の長宗我部元親である。
sen.e: It was Motochika CHOSOKABE, the son of Kunichika, who made use of Ichiryo gusoku eagerly and effectively.
It was Motochika CHOSOKABE, the son of Kunichika, who made use of Ichiryo gusoku eagerly and effectively.
It was Motochika CHOSOKABE, the son of Kunichika, who made use of Ichiryo gusoku eagerly and effectively.

sen.j: 元親は精強な一領具足を率いて四国統一を果たしたが、豊臣秀吉による四国征伐によって、元親の領地は大幅に削減され、土佐一国のみとなる。
sen.e: Motochika, leading powerful Ichiryogusoku, achieved the unification of Shikoku region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Motochika, leading powerful Ichiryogusoku, achieved the unification of Shikoku region, however, the territory was reduced to only Tosa Province due to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's Shikoku Conquest.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしなくてもよいと思われます。
sen.e: Motochika, leading powerful Ichiryogusoku, achieved the unification of Shikoku region, however, the territory was reduced to only Tosa Province due to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's Shikoku Conquest.

sen.j: さらにその後の関ヶ原の戦いでは、家督を継承していた元親の四男長宗我部盛親が西軍に与したため、戦後、所領は没収され改易となった。
sen.e: Further, in the subsequent Battle of Sekigahara, Motochika's forth son, Morichika CHOSOKABE who took over as head of the family, was joined to the Western Camp, leading to confiscation of shoryo (territory) and Kaieki (forfeit rank of Samurai and properties) after the war.

sen.j: 長宗我部家の後継として土佐を与えられたのは山内一豊だったが、長宗我部家の遺臣団は新領主の登場を必ずしも歓迎しなかった。
sen.e: As the successor of the Chosokabe family, Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI was allowed to administer Tosa Province, while the remnant corps of the Chosokabe family did not necessarily favor the appearance of the new load.

sen.j: 竹内惣右衛門を中心とする一領具足は、浦戸城の引渡しを拒否し、盛親に旧領の一部（土佐半国という）を与えることを要求した（浦戸一揆）。
sen.e: Soemon TAKEUCHI and his Ichiryo gusoku members objected to hand over the Urato-jo Castle and demanded that Morichika should be given a part of the old territory (half land of Tosa). (Urado riot)

sen.e: The Yamanouchi clan suppressed them and took up the Chosokabe remnant corps including Ichiryo gusoku as a rank of goshi (country samurai) which was below the feudal retainer of domain (Joshi (superior warrior)).
